Class PrintHighScores

  • java.lang.Object
    • PrintHighScores
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.print.Printable

    public class PrintHighScores
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.print.Printable
    The PrintHighScores class is used to print the high scores on a piece of paper when the user when clicks the "Print" button in the high scores class.
    Version:
    5 06.09.15 Time Spent by Jasmine Ou: none. Time Spent by Laura Wong: 4 hours.

    name: PrintHighScores.java

    Instance Variables

    pj This is the PrinterJob variable used to get the printer job.

    Author:
    Laura Wong

    • Method Detail

      • print

        public int print(java.awt.Graphics g,
                 java.awt.print.PageFormat format,
                 int pageNum)
          throws java.awt.print.PrinterException
        The print method is used to see if there is a printer connected or not, if not, it returns NO_SUCH_PAGE and if there is it returns PAGE_EXISTS. It also formats how the printed page will look on the actual peice of paper. The first if statement is used to see if pageNum is equal to larger than zero, if it is, it will return NO_SUCH_PAGE. The first loop is used to output the current scores and the current names, positions and the scores from the HighScores class in a certain location. It also draws the CookieByte logo.

        Local Variables

        g2d This is a Graphics2D variable that is used to tranlate the information to the printer with the specified format.

        num This is a String variable that is used to indicate how many high scores are in the file.

        x This is the variable that is used inside the loops.

        logo This is the logo of the CookieByte company.

        Specified by:
        print in interface java.awt.print.Printable
        Parameters:
        g - This is the Graphics variable the drawing on the printer.
        format - This is the specific PageFormat that the high scores will be using.
        pageNum - This is the number of pages.
        Returns:
        int value
        Throws:
        java.awt.print.PrinterException - This is incase there is no printer available.

      • actualPrint

        public void actualPrint()
        The actualPrint method actual does the printing. The if statement is used to indicate if ok is true or not. The try block is used to make sure that the print will actually print, if not, it will catch the printerException.

        Local Variables

        print This is a PrinterJob variable to get the PrinterJob

        ok This is a boolean variable used to ensure that the printDialog is ok.

        PrinterException. This is the exception that is made when the print job didn't work properly.
